title: breaking labeled while-loop in const assignment results in ICE

labels.name: E-easy
labels.description: Call for participation: Experience needed to fix: Easy / not much (good first issue)

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

body:
A while ago, this would cause an illigal instruction, but has been fixed, see https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/50856 , and no longer is an issue in the current nightly.
```Rust
'a: while break 'a {};
```
Except, using such code while creating a constant, results in an ICE:
https://play.rust-lang.org/?gist=e974c3b625754ce340a4bd77bd3b7235&version=nightly&mode=debug
```Rust
const crash: () = 'a: while break 'a {};

fn main() {

}
```
This is rustc 1.28.0-nightly (5d0631a64 2018-05-30).

Backtrace:
```
error: internal compiler error: librustc_mir\transform\qualify_consts.rs:272: multiple assignments to _0
 --> src\main.rs:1:19
  |
1 | const crash: () = 'a: while break 'a {};
  |                   ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

thread 'main' panicked at 'Box<Any>', librustc_errors\lib.rs:499:9
stack backtrace:

   2: std::panicking::take_hook
   3: std::panicking::take_hook

end of query stack
error: aborting due to previous error
```
